body_html:
Oh, what distro is this? We only support Ubuntu and CentOS.

In any case, it's a bug in the compiler AFAICT. All you need is to make that closure work. You need to capture sparse_slice, slice, and slice_num*j. Alternatively you can change the declaration of sparse_slice to SparseSlice<TL>*.
body_text:
Oh, what distro is this? We only support Ubuntu and CentOS.
In any case, it's a bug in the compiler AFAICT. All you need is to make that closure work. You need to capture sparse_slice, slice, and slice_num*j. Alternatively you can change the declaration of sparse_slice to SparseSlice<TL>*.
body:
Oh, what distro is this? We only support Ubuntu and CentOS.

In any case, it's a bug in the compiler AFAICT. All you need is to make that closure work. You need to capture `sparse_slice`, `slice`, and `slice_num*j`. Alternatively you can change the declaration of `sparse_slice` to `SparseSlice<TL>*`.
